newsitem.title: USA: Sony PlayStation, software sales top $1 billion.
newsitem.headline: Sony PlayStation, software sales top $1 billion.

text.p: Sony Computer Entertainment America, a unit of Sony Corp, Tuesday said combined North American sales of hardware and software for its PlayStation brand have topped $1 billion this year.
Sales figures includes Sony's PlayStation game consoles, Sony's software for the system and other licensed software.
The company said more than two million PlayStation units had been sold by December 1, and an additional one million are expected to be sold during the holiday season.

An individual revenue breakdown of hardware versus software was not available, nor were spokespersons at Foster City-Calif.-based Sony. Earlier this month, Sony said worldwide console shipments had exceeded 10 million units by November.
While Sony markets software for the unit, a variety of firms like Midway Games Inc, Square Co Ltd and Electronic Arts Inc market popular games for the system.

In a statemnt, Kaz Hirai, an executive at Sony Computer Entertainment America, said, "Revenues have far exceeded our initial expectations. We entered this market one year ago and now we are the undisputed worldwide leader."
The CD-based PlayStation game console retails for $199, with software titles ranging in price between $40 and $60.
